page.title: 04GARDEN COTTAGE * HEDGERLEY
page.content: This is an old cottage that was once part of Hedgerley Park Estate. It was called Garden Cottage because six gardeners used to live there. The cottage is 250 yeras old. The house opposite was a butlers house but it is not quite as old as Garden Cottage. Some of the bricks in the walls were made in the Hedgerley brick kiln. Garden cottage has a very large walled garden. At the back of the garden is a big black gate that leads to a wood. There is an orchard at the side of the garden which was on a map of Hedgerley in 1670. Many of the men were farmers and also some worked in the slate houses. The first shop in Hedgerley was a Post Office at Dean Cottages.
